meanings.definition: A taste or experience of something that is to come
meanings.sent1: The small bite of cake gave me a foretaste of the delicious dessert to come.
meanings.sent2: The first snowfall was a foretaste of the long winter ahead.
meanings.sent3: The quick smell of fresh bread was a foretaste of the bakery's delights.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of music was a foretaste of the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent5: The glimpse of the sunrise was a foretaste of the beauty of the day.

meanings.definition: To have a taste or experience of something before it actually happens
meanings.sent1: She foretastes the excitement of the roller coaster as she waits in line.
meanings.sent2: He foretastes the joy of the weekend by planning fun activities.
meanings.sent3: The cat foretastes the treat by eagerly watching its owner prepare it.
meanings.sent4: The students foretaste the freedom of summer break as the school year ends.
meanings.sent5: The chef foretastes the flavors of the dish as it simmers on the stove.
